fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have an expand macro on a Confluence page. Then access that page through the JSM customer portal. The dropdown arrow overlaps itself resulting in the arrows to look like the below screenshot:

!Screen Shot 2021-10-04 at 1.36.11 PM.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence Cloud page with the expand macro
 # Link the Confluence Space/page to a JSM project
 # Navigate to the page through the JSM customer portal
 # You'll see the arrow overlapping itself

h3. Expected Results

The arrow should not overlap it's self
h3. Actual Results
The macro overlaps itself and looks like the below image:
!Screen Shot 2021-10-04 at 1.36.11 PM.png!

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: In the JSM customer portal the expand macro arrow overlaps itself

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a space administrator, when trying to search for [guest users|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/invite-guests-for-external-collaboration/] under the *Internal users*, it will not display the user, which is great. However, when searching for a group under the *Internal* *groups* part, it will display the guest groups.

However, as soon as the group is attempted to be added, the following error message is displayed:
{quote}GROUP_X is a guest group and cannot be added as an internal group.
{quote}
h3. Suggestion

This is a suggestion to not display guest groups under the search for space permissions. Although they cannot be added, this could help avoiding confusion.
fields.summary: Remove guest groups from the internal space permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When [guests are added to an instance|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/invite-guests-for-external-collaboration/], editing space permissions will only display them under the *Guest users* part as they are not supposed to be added as internal users.

However, by using the user picker option (magnifying glass), the user will be displayed under the *Membership* tab.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As an administrator, make sure to create a guest group and [invite a guest to it|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/invite-guests-for-external-collaboration/].
 # Now, as a space administrator, access a space and tap *Space settings*
 # Under the *Permissions* option, edit it and tap the user picker option (magnifying glass)
 # Select the *Membership* tab and add the name of the guest group.

h3. Expected Results

The guest group or the list of guests should not be displayed on the Internal users part*.*
h3. Actual Results

The guests are displayed and can be selected. However, when trying to add the guest with the *Add* button, the following error message will be displayed:
{quote}USER_X is a guest and cannot be added as an internal user
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Guests are displayed under the user picker for internal users in the space permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When [creating a guest group for external collaboration|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/invite-guests-for-external-collaboration/], if an internal user is added to this group, it will make it to be considered both a guest and an internal group, which causes further issues like:
 * It will be available to be sleected under both the *Guests* and *Internal* groups part of space permissions.
 * Adding the group will put it under the *Internal* permission part of the space.
 * The space will have the *Shared with guests* flag even though the group is added to the internal permissions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As an administrator, create a group to be used as a guest one.
 # Under the *Product access* part, add this group on the *Guests* tab.
 # Add guests to this group and at least one "internal" user.

h3. Expected Results

The group should be considered guest-only, blocking internal users to be added.
h3. Actual Results

The internal user is added, causing further issues related to the permissions of the spaces.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding internal users to guest groups will make it an internal and guest group

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When [guests|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/invite-guests-for-external-collaboration/] are added to internal groups, they should become internal-only users:
{quote}Guests only retain the systemic guest permission as long as the groups they’ve been added to ONLY consist of groups that were created specifically as a guest group.

If they’re added as member of any regular groups, they’ll be given the same access to your site as your regular users have. This is because Confluence’s permissions model incorporates additive permissions.
{quote}
However, instead of only being considered internal users, they are still kept with the *Guests* flag in the profile, also causing space permissions to interpret them with both guest and internal users access.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [Invite a guest for external collaboration|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/invite-guests-for-external-collaboration/]
 # Add this user to an internal group of Confluence.

h3. Expected Results

The user should only have Confluence internal product access under the user management.
h3. Actual Results

The user has both Confluence and guest access. This causes the following issues to happen:
 * The user field (to add new users) in the spaces will have the user displayed in both *Internal* and *Guests* permissions.
 * When adding the user via the *Guest* part of the space permissions, the user will be displayed under the *Individual* part, but the space will still have the *Shared with guests* message at the sidebar, causing confusion to understanding why the flag is displayed.
 * When tapping on the *Shared with guests* message of the spaces, no users will be displayed. Instead, a "Failed to load. Please refresh the page" message is displayed. Reloading does not change the behavior.

h3. Workaround

Manually remove the user from the guest groups.
fields.summary: Guests added to internal groups are not fully converted to internal users

fields.description:
h3.Summary

The [External collaboration|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/invite-guests-for-external-collaboration/] allows users to be added as guests with limited access to Confluence and some of the macros.

When guests try to view macros or roadmaps from Jira, the information will not be displayed until these users are granted product access to Jira.

h3.Suggestion

Since guests are users supposed to have limited information to Confluence, granting them product access to Jira would expose all the project information and require a license to Jira as well.

This is a suggestion to allow guests to be able to see macros from Jira without having product access to it.
fields.summary: Allow guests to view Jira issues without access to Jira

fields.description:
h3.Summary

In Confluence, even though the Global Permissions are not configured for [anonymous/public access|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-public-access/], users can still configure the space permissions to have anonymous access enabled.

When this permission is configured only at a space level, this will allow any licensed, [unlicensed|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/give-access-to-unlicensed-users-from-jira-service-management/] and [guests|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/invite-guests-for-external-collaboration/] to view the content within it, bypassing its existing permissions.

h3.Suggestion

Although it could be expected to have everyone viewing it since this permission indicates that the space would be open for everyone, there is no warning or message while configuring it as a space admin.

This is a suggestion for some options like the following:

* Have a clear message that although the global permissions are not set to public access, this would allow anyone to view this space, including unlicensed users and guests.
* Do not allow this permission to bypass any other configured permissions if there are no global permissions configured for public access.
fields.summary: Improve anonymous access handling at a space level

fields.description:
h3. Problem
h3. Suggested Solution

Customers would like to have a macro that can handle a preset list of Jira tasks and their assignees for stories with several people assigned via the tasking macro. 

Currently the task auto create because they are on the originating template. At the time that a story is created and published on the first time, they don't want to send the task assignees a message. 

There might be days before the story is ready to the task assignees to perform their task. Customers are hoping a macro can be created with the preset list of task and their assignees. When the story is ready for others to perform their task, the author of the story applies the macro and presto the list of tasks appear. 
h3. Why This Is Important

_This will add better tasking managing tools for customers that use the Jira Tasks Macro on confluence._ 
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Create a macro to paste a list of tasks

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When a calendar has [Jira events|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-jira-events/] and get [exported|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/export-to-other-calendars/], these events will not be carried because they rely on the Jira configuration to be displayed:

{quote}
You can't add content to JIRA calendars as they source all of their date information from the JIRA system. To add issues and version deadlines, add them in the JIRA application's interface.
{quote}

This might bring issues when importing these calendars under different Confluence instances since [retrieving projects from externally integrated Jira instances does not work in Team Calendars|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-72906], which the only workaround would be to re-configure it on the Jira project where the calendar has been imported to.

h3.Suggestion

This is a suggestion to display the Jira events as read-only when a calendar is imported, even though it relies on the Jira information. 

This way, even if there is a limitation to display it from externally integrated systems, requiring a manual configuration to be done in both the calendars and Jira, the data can at least be visible.
fields.summary: Allow Jira events to be exported/imported with Team Calendars

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When [adding Jira events to Team Calendars|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-jira-events/], it will require information from Jira so those can be created:

{quote}
You can't add content to JIRA calendars as they source all of their date information from the JIRA system. To add issues and version deadlines, add them in the JIRA application's interface.
{quote}

However, when attempting to retrieve content from an external Jira instance connected via [Application Links|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/use-applinks-to-link-to-atlassian-products/], the drop downs to select projects will not work. 

Although the *Server* option shows the externally connected instance to be selected, the *Project* drop down will not display any existing projects and the following information will be displayed:

{quote}
No projects found
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# As an administrator of Confluence, integrate the instance with a Jira instance from a different tenat/URL via [Application links|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/use-applinks-to-link-to-atlassian-products/].
# Once the integration is completed, access an existing calendar and open the pop-up to [add a Jira event|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-jira-events/].
# Once the *Server* dropdown, select the newly connected application link/Jira instance.
# Tap the *Project* dropdown to display a list of projects to be selected.

h3. Expected Results

The projects should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

No projects are displayed. A message with a *Project not found* is displayed when tapping the drop-down:

!no_projects.png|thumbnail!

(i) This has also impact on calendars that get imported into a different instance. If the bundled/system Jira instance does not have the Jira project configured and integrated, the events will not be "imported".

For example, if the calendar has *Jira project release* events, it will not be displayed at all when imported since the bundled Jira instance would not have the [Releases imported due to a limitation|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67933].

h3. Workaround

Manually [import the Jira project|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/import-and-export-your-data-to-and-from-jira-cloud/] into the system/bundled Jira instance under the same URL as Confluence.
fields.summary: Retrieving projects from externally integrated Jira instances does not work in Team Calendars
Table header occludes the row when the row is set as header

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When pasting Jira issue links into Confluence pages or using the [Jira macros|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-jira-issues-macro/], different features will benefit from it, such as:

* Smart cards to display Jira information in Confluence.
* Confluence page links in Jira.
* The total number of issues at the top of the Confluence page.

However, if the issue key changes due to moving issues to different projects or other scenarios such as restoring issues that can't use the same key, the links on the Confluence side will be either pointing to broken URLs or wrong Jira issues.

h3.Suggestion

This is a suggestion to allow users to use issue ID instead of issue key so the information can keep being displayed even if the issue key changes in Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to use Issue ID instead of key for the Jira macros

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the TOC (Table of Contents) macro only display links to headings within the page.
It would be useful to be able to generate a similar list for child pages.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a separated macro or add this option to the current TOC macro.
fields.summary: Macro to display TOC for child pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating multiple Issues in Confluence, they're not showing under Jira. It's possible to create only one.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a Confluence page and edit it.
 # Click on insert > Jira
 # On the search text field, enter more than one Jira issue key like TEST-1, TEST2
 # Click on the search icon and insert the Jira ticket

h3. Expected Results

Jira should link the Confluence page on the Jira ticket.
h3. Actual Results

Jira is not linking the Confluence page to the tickets.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When adding multiple Jira Issues in Confluence, they're not showing mentioned on Jira.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Although [creating pages via API loads the new/current editor|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-68057], when [a space is created via API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-space/#api-wiki-rest-api-space-post], the home/overview page still uses the legacy editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to have [permissions to create spaces in Confluence|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/manage-global-permissions/#Manage-what-licensed-users-can-do-on-your-Confluence-site].
# Use the [API to create spaces|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-space/#api-wiki-rest-api-space-post] to have a new space created.

(i) Make sure to [create an API token|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-api-tokens-for-your-atlassian-account/] to create the space via API. You can also [convert the email/API token into basic authentication method|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/basic-auth-for-rest-apis/#supplying-basic-auth-headers]

h3. Expected Results

The home page of the space should have the new/current editor:

!new_home.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

The home page is created with the legacy editor:

!legacy_home.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

After having the space created, edit and publish the home page, which will open it in the new/current editor.
fields.summary: Creating spaces via API doesn't load the new/current editor for the home page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we create a new page, we have the option to invite users to edit it with you. For that, there's the *Invite to Edit* button at the top of the page.

If the page has never been published yet, users invited through the button will get a message saying the page is restricted.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page (draft only, don't publish it).
 # Click on *Invite to Edit*.
 # Invite a user.
 # The user will get an email notification that takes them to the page to be edited. Click on the link from the email.

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to edit the page.
h3. Actual Results

Users get a message saying the page is restricted:


The URL from the email notification looks like this:
{code:java}
/wiki/spaces/~826734623/pages/edit-v2/1801388033
{code}
While the correct one should be like:
{code:java}
/wiki/spaces/~826734623/pages/edit-v2/1801388033?draftShareId=2b182016-63c7-4d0b-9158-1e1a0b09ee30{code}
 {code}
h3. Workaround
 # You can either copy the URL from the draft and send it to the users directly
 # Or publish the page first and then invite the users to edit the page.
fields.summary: Users are unable to edit unpublished pages when they are invited through the Invite to Edit button

fields.description:
Common practice for an action with complicated steps is for the Jira ticket to reference a Confluence doc with more detail in.  Auditors do not like this!  Because obviously the Confluence doc could change, maybe between approval and execution but easily between approval and auditing.  So common practice is to link to a specific version of said page - that is a nice permalink to an immutable page.  This is great.

Except there doesn't seem to be a way to generate a permalink to the current version of the page, referencing the current version, so that when that page is changed, the link points to the version at the time!  There *is* a current version for pages, but you can't easily get a link to it.  Can that be made easy to do please?   The current method is to make a trivial change and link to the previous version.  I am trying to get engineers who barely care about such things to make auditable links to documents - it has GOT to be easy or people will not do it.

This would make a big change to the auditability of Jira/Confluence interactions!
fields.summary: Create easy permalink to current page version

fields.description:
At the moment the create space API is only able to create a blank space while there are multiple space templates available. 

 !template.png|thumbnail! 

In the endpoint *POST /wiki/rest/api/space* there is no parameter for choosing a template. 

Suggestion :
Allow to choose a space template via create space REST API endpoint
fields.summary: Allow to choose a space template via create space REST API endpoint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* When Anonymous or Public access is enabled, WebDav integration between Team Calendar and Outlook cannot be set up.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# First, make sure Anonymous access is turned "OFF" on in the Global permissions page.
# Follow the guide below to Subscribe to Team Calendars from Microsoft Outlook
** https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/subscribe-to-team-calendars-from-microsoft-outlook/
# In the *Test or discover settings* step, make sure that the connection works, and that the calendars are discoverable.
# Now turn "ON" Anonymous access in the Global permissions page.
# Proceed with the same steps as before, and click on *Test or discover settings*.
# It will fail with the error below.
** {code:java}
401: Unauthorized The request has not been applied because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource.
{code}

h3. Expected Results
* Users should be able to subscribe to Team Calendars even if Anonymous access is enabled, as they're authenticated users.

h3. Actual Results
* Authenticated users are not able to subscribe to Team Calendars via WebDav when Anonymous access is enabled.

h3. Workaround
No workaround other than to turn of anonymous access on the global level.
fields.summary: Outlook Webdav integration with Team Calendar fails when Anonymous or Public access is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Copy Page Hierarchy copy API (https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content---children-and-descendants/#api-wiki-rest-api-content-id-pagehierarchy-copy-post) takes parameters allowing the titles of copied pages to be specified. When this results in a conflict, the error returned by the API can be slightly misleading in the sense of where to look for the conflict.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page titled ConflictBugParent (let's refer to the allocated content ID of this page as conflict-bug-parent).
 # Within page ConflictBugParent, create a child page titled ConflictBug (let's refer to the allocated content ID of this page as conflict-bug).
 # Outside the ConflictBugParent hierarchy, create a page titled Template-ConflictBug (let's refer to the allocated content ID of this page as template-conflict-bug).
 # Invoke the as indicated in the following curl command and observe the error message returned:

 
{code:java}
curl --request POST \
  --url 'https://some-tenant.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/template-conflict-bug/pagehierarchy/copy' \
  --user '' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
    "copyAttachments": true,
    "copyPermissions": false,
    "copyProperties": true,
    "copyLabels": true,
    "copyCustomContents": true,
    "destinationPageId": "conflict-bug-parent",
    "titleOptions": {
      "prefix": "",
      "replace": "",
      "search": "Template-"
    }
  }'
{code}
 
h3. Expected Results

The Copy Fails with the message:
{quote}The copied pages have conflicting page titles. e.g.: ConflictBug. Please specify a page title prefix to avoid conflict.
{quote}
h3. Actual Results

The Copy Fails with the message:
{quote}The copied pages have conflicting page titles. e.g.: Template-ConflictBug. Please specify a page title prefix to avoid conflict.
{quote}
This is misleading because the error is referencing the old title of the page before the titleOptions are applied.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Copy Page Hierarchy API error message reporting title conflict

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We are observing a long time taken by test 
 _testCanGetUserProfileWhenCircuitBreakerIsOpen_ as part of *BatchBulkUserProfileClientImplTest* 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # check surefire logs for few builds and check time taken on the test

h3. Expected Results

comparing to other tests taking <10s the time is quite high for a mock test.
h3. Actual Results

Average time taken
{noformat}
90.004 com.atlassian.confluence.identity.userprofile.impl.BatchBulkUserProfileClientImplTest.testCanGetUserProfileWhenCircuitBreakerIsOpen
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

This mean is calculated based on sure-fire reports , since everything in the test is mocked, please check the logic and see why it should be taking this long.
fields.summary: Investigate why testCanGetUserProfileWhenCircuitBreakerIsOpen taking more than 90 seconds

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Recently updated macro doesn't allow to include more than one space in the new editing experience.
The documentation mentions this should be possible: [Insert the recently updated macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-recently-updated-macro/]

{quote}You can specify one or more space keys, separated by a comma or a space.{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Insert the recently updated macro and add more than one space key in the Space(s) field. 

h3. Expected Results
The recently updated macro should accept more than one space key.

h3. Actual Results
The macro only accepts one space at a time. 

h3. Workaround
No known workaround other than creating individual macros for each space.
fields.summary: Impossible to set more than one space in Recently updated pages macro

fields.description: When a user is added to Confluence, she/he will be set as a watcher on the first space that is being visited. This should be optional and proactively asked.
fields.summary: Disable auto-watching of first visited space in Conflunce

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If we link a page which has line break in title it will break the page links from the other pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Copy a line of text from a text editor (pic1)

# Step 2 Edit (or create a new) Confluence page and paste the line of text as title. You will see the page break at the exact same position as in the copied line. (pic2)
# Step 3 Publish the page. You wont see any line break (pic3)
# Step 4 Go to another page an try to link the other page (pic4). You will see the line break again in the preview in the Editor
# Step 5 Publish this page also. You will find an empty spot where you would expect the link (pic5).


h3. Expected Results
Links should be visible on the page.

h3. Actual Results
Page link is unavailable.

h3. Workaround

Remove the line break from the title
fields.summary: Line break in page title wrecks links to the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using themed pages in Confluence Cloud, there are some issues with paddings. These are mostly evident in comments.

These are the known issues:
- Content is right against the edge of the container (there is no padding)
- The focussed comment highlight overflows the container.
- The content body padding itself is not being applied

h3. Expected Results
There are no issues with the look and feel of the pages (e.g. no overflows or padding being too small)

h3. Actual Results
There are visible issues with the look and feel of the pages.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issues with paddings when using themed pages

fields.description: Customer suggested to implement a feature that enables update more than one Attachment Link or single link at once.
fields.summary: Bulk Update in more than one Link (Attachments)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating additional inline macros, or copying paste it on a page, the second and subsequent macro's content will not be displayed while the page is on edit mode.

!image-20210922-203336.png|width=383,height=230!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Created a custom macro and installed in my confluence instance (hello world macro);

 # Created a new page.

 # Inserted the macro, it was added to the page as expected.

 # Inserted the same macro again (twice now) to the page, it was added but its content was not displayed.

 # Published the page, now both macros are displayed as expected.

h3. Expected Results

The same content as the first macro would be displayed in all macros
h3. Actual Results

second and subsequent macro has no content displayed
h3. Workaround

na
fields.summary: Copying/creating a second inline macro on a page causes the content to not be displayed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users who have site access but not product access to Confluence are unable to self join Confluence if Confluence has anonymous access enabled. Instead, they only see the anonymous Confluence pages with no option to join Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a site with Confluence, anonymous access enabled and a user who has site access but not Confluence access.
# Visit Confluence as this user.
# Confirm that you can only visit anonymous Confluence pages and are unable to join Confluence.

h3. Expected Results
The user has some way of joining Confluence as a licensed user.

h3. Actual Results
The user is not able to become a licensed user via self sign up.

h3. Workaround
Manually add this user to a group that grants Confluence product access. More information here on [updating product access|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/update-product-access-settings/].
fields.summary: Unable to self sign up for Confluence when anonymous access is enabled and user is apart of the site userbase

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

PDF exports show full page URLs instead of inline display when the page name contains "_" without special character
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create page A with any title including "_" ( eg. test_ABC )
 # Create page B and use link macro to create a hyperlink for page A and display configuration should be "inline"
 # Publish page B
 # Edit page B again
 # Publish it again
 # Export page B to pdf

h3. Expected Results

The exported page should show the link as inline display 
h3. Actual Results

The exported page will contain the full URL of page A instead of inline display
h3. Workaround

Either remove the "_" character from the page title else add a special character ( eg. ä) as well ( eg. test_abcä)
fields.summary: PDF export shows links to other pages as full URL instead of inline

fields.description:
{panel:title= Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Given the recent facelifts, now there are more chances to see icons of the Custom Template; however, there's no way to specify the icon.
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-28 at 14.59.30.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-09-28 at 14.56.17.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-09-28 at 14.57.29.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a menu to configure the icon per Custom Template.
h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Ability to set an icon per Custom Template

h3. Issue Summary

When creating a new space using the API [create space/get space API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-space/#api-wiki-rest-api-space-post] with attribute "unlicensedAccess" as 'true'. [Create Space API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-space/#api-wiki-rest-api-space-post]

"unlicensedAccess" should be set to 'true'

When configuring Jira Issue Dates to be displayed in Team calendars, if you only want to display date ranges from issues, you cannot save the configuration unless at least one "single date" option is selected. This can force either extra events or cause duplicate events that are unwanted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with issues that have a start and end date field

The configuration is saved with only the date ranges

The configuration is not saved unless you select a date field to also populate single days

Select a date field that is available, but not used the the project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* As part of the work to allow group renames, we're making changes to allow groups to be referred to by their group ID instead of group names.
* This is causing issues with Confluence's Space permissions and restrictions.
** When a group is deleted, and the group is used in a page's restriction,  the restriction window can no longer load on a page.
*** When the group is re-created with same name, the issue with the restriction persist.
** When a group is given Space permission, deleting the group removes it from the Space permission.
*** When a group with the same name is re-created, the group is not added back to the Space permission, but all users in the group will still have access to the Space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Space.
# Create a test group, *TestGroup*.
** Add another user into this group, *User 2*.
# Add *TestGroup* to the Space's Space permission.
# Create a page in the Space.
# Add view/edit restrictions to the page, and add yourself, and *TestGroup* to the restrictions.
# Confirm that *User 2*, and yourself are the only users who are able to view the page.
# Now delete the *TestGroup* group.
# *User 2* will no longer be able to access the page or the Space. (/)
# Try to view the restriction on the page, and it will fail to load. (x) *(Update: This is fixed)*
# Recreate a new user group with the same name, *TestGroup*.
** Add *User 2* back into the group.
# Try to view the restriction on the page, and it will still fail to load. (x)
# View the Space's permission, and *TestGroup* will not be shown there. (/)
# Try accessing the Space and restricted page as *User 2*, they'll still have access to the Space and page. (x)

h4. Update (13/10/21)
# The issue with restrictions is fixed. 
# Issue with the users being able to access previous Spaces that the groups were able to access still exist.

h3. Expected Results
# Group should be removed from restrictions when it is deleted, like it is removed from the Space permissions.
# Re-creating the group with the same name should not give access back to users, as the group is not added back to the Space.

h3. Actual Results
# Deleting a group causes page restriction pop-up to be broken on pages that has the group in its restriction.
# Re-creating a group with the same name gives access to users in that group, even if the group is not re-added into the Space's permission.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleting group does not remove it from restrictions and permissions
PDF Export top right custom header rule not working correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Taking Confluence's Open API (aka "swagger") spec, and trying to generate a client (e.g. in Java) does not produce valid source. There seem to be various errors and missing types in the spec.

Note there are a couple of bugs in swagger-codegen 3.0.27 that interact badly with Confluence. Using 3.0.28-SNAPSHOT or newer overcomes these errors.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Download a copy of https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/swagger.v3.json
 # Use a tool like swagger-codegen to generate Java source. e.g. "swagger-codegen -i swagger.v3.json -l java -o ."
# Try to compile the generated code 

h3. Expected Results

The code compiles without error.

h3. Actual Results

ContentBody is missing the type ContentBodyExpandable
Content is missing the type Map
etc

Most of these errors look to be due to the incorrect addition of the following entry in various places:

additionalProperties: true

This seems incorrect.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Generating source code from Confluence's Open API spec produces invalid source code

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the include page macro, it is possible to search for pages by typing its title, but is no longer is allowing to search using its spacekey: pagetitlename, as mentioned in the [documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-include-page-macro/]:
{quote} If the page or blog post is located in another space, add the space key and a colon in front of the page name. For example, DOC:My page name. The space key is case sensitive.{quote}

This difficult finding the pages from the right space, as sometimes, the results does not appears correctly on the search box.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in a space called A
 # Create a space B and give it a spaceB as spacekey
# Create a new page on space B with the title pagetitle.
 # On space A, insert the include page macro in a new page
# Search for the page in the space B by typing the space key *spaceB: pagetitle*

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to find the page by its space key and page title specified above and on our documentation [Insert the include page macro - Parameters|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-include-page-macro/]

h3. Actual Results
There are no results if you try to find the page by its space key in the search.

h3. Workaround
Type the page title's name. It should specify from which space it is on the search dialogue.
fields.summary: Include page macro no longer allows to search page using the spacekey in the searchbox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Include page macro returns an error "unable to render {include}" if the page has a colon symbol : in the page title, if the page is from the same space where you are trying to include the page.
It happens on the new editor.
It works normally if the page is from another space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a parent page that will contain *Include Page* macro on a space A.
 # Create another page that contain colon on the title, for example: 'Atlassian::Testing Page' or 'Atlassian:TestPage' on the same space A.
# Insert the include page macro on the parent page
# Search for 'Atlassian::Testing Page' or 'Atlassian:TestPage'
# Click on the search results for the page to include it

h3. Expected Results
The content on the include page macro shows as expected in the macro.

h3. Actual Results
The unable to render {include} error is displayed instead of the page content.

h3. Workaround
Currently, the workaround would be renaming the page to remove the colon or, adding a space after the colon, for example:
Original title: Atlassian::Testing Page' or 'Atlassian:TestPage'
Modified title workaround: 'Atlassian: TestPage'.

*Notes:*
If there is a space before the colon or after a colon, it works.
If the page title has two colons next after the other like in this example Atlassian::Testing Page, adding a space after the second colon does not work.
fields.summary: Include page macro returns an error if the page from the same space has colon on the title

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a page, we can add labels to it. When clicking on the label icon at the top of the page, the pop-up for choose a label never shows up.

This issue is *only* happening on the Legacy editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the *Legacy template*.
# Click on the label icon at the top of the page.

h3. Expected Results
The pop-up to choose a label should appear.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens when clicking on the label icon. We get the following error message on the console:
{noformat}
react-dom.production.min.js:52 Uncaught TypeError: e.showDialog is not a function
    at Object.current (LabelsComponent.js:96)
    at usePlatformLeafEventHandler.js:55
    at Object.s (react-dom.production.min.js:14)
    at h (react-dom.production.min.js:14)
    at react-dom.production.min.js:14
    at m (react-dom.production.min.js:15)
    at st (react-dom.production.min.js:52)
    at it (react-dom.production.min.js:51)
    at ut (react-dom.production.min.js:52)
    at dt (react-dom.production.min.js:56)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Users can add labels to the page on the view mode (published). Or, they can convert the page to the Fabric editor.

h3. Note
If the page is also an Overview (home page) then it is not possible to edit the labels at all due to [CONFCLOUD-57258|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-57258]

Copying page results in duplicate key value violates unique constraint error, but works on another attempt 10-15 minutes later.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Dialogue locks up

h3. Expected Results

Page copies successfully.
h3. Actual Results

!CleanShot 2021-09-24 at 10.23.35@2x.png|width=455,height=276!

Copy page locks up, and the below exception is thrown:
{noformat}
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: could not execute statement; sql=n/a; ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "xxxxxxx"
  Detail: Key (lock_id)=(task:com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.service.longtasks.BulkPageCopyTaskRunner.ContentId{id=00000000}->ContentId{id=00000001}) already exists.; nested exception is org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "xxxxxxx"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When [using team calendars|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-team-calendars-for-confluence/] with specific environments, after adding a couple of events, including some that will have extended date ranges, those will start overlapping each other, impacting the visibility and access to them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the Team Calendars macro to a page and select a calendar.
 # Make sure to add a couple of events to this calendar, including events that will have an extended date.
 # In specific environments (I.E. RDP connections, VMs, Windows), access it with a window that is not maximized (these might happen with maximized windows as well)

(i) The issue can be also triggered by creating a new event in the calendar with a couple of events already added.

h3. Expected Results

The events should be properly displayed within the calendar.

h3. Actual Results

The events are overlapping, like the example below:

!overlap_example.png|thumbnail!

h4.Additional notes

This has been reproduced with environments and variables such as:

* Not using a maximized window in the browser.
* Connected via a VM/RDP (I.E. Windows 10, Windows Server 2019, Linux).
* With specific OS configurations that would impact even without using a VM.

h3. Workaround

Different workarounds can help, depending on the environment/configuration. However, as soon as the page is refreshed, the issue should be back:

* Drag and drop the browser window to change its size and put it back.
* Maximize the browser's window size.
* Collapse the sidebar and put it back to its normal size.
fields.summary: [FE] Team Calendar events overlap when accessed in specific environments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the status query param is left out of an update content request for an unpublished page where the body indicates the page should be published, the publish logic is skipped. The page can still be viewed as if it was published, but underlying state can cause subsequent edit and publish attempts to fail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make a create content request (POST /wiki/rest/api/content) with the body content status set to draft
 # Make an update content request for the page from step 1 (PUT /wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}) without the status query param and with the body content status set to current
 # Open the page in the editor and quickly edit and publish (do not idle long enough for draft sync to occur)

h3. Expected Results

Page publishes successfullly
h3. Actual Results

An error is shown indicating the page could not be found. The publish request returns a 404 response.
h3. Workaround

Pause for at least 5 seconds at some point between edits before publishing, which will result in a draft sync and correct the underlying issue.
fields.summary: Omitting status query param when updating content on an unpublished page skips publishing logic

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Links to new Vimeo videos no longer work via the Object Connector due to Vimeo requiring a hash value at the end of the URL.

Vimeo URLs have this format: [https://vimeo.com/videoID/hashID]

Currently, the Object Connector macro in Confluence is not putting the full Vimeo.com URL (entered into the URL field) into the src parameter when generating the iframe. The hash value is not being kept.

For example, I entered [https://vimeo.com/607733378/10c39589bd] into the URL field of the Object Connector, which generated a src parameter without the hash value (after the last /).

Generated iframe:
<iframe allowfullscreen="" allowtransparency="true" class="fullscreen-video-iframe conf-macro output-block" data-hasbody="false" data-macro-id="7d7b61e6-20a5-492c-8079-2f83f98a2f6d" data-macro-name="widget" frameborder="0" height="380" mozallowfullscreen="" src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/607733378" style="border:none; margin:1em 0em;" webkitallowfullscreen="" width="640">
</iframe>
h3. Suggested Solution

_Customer needs to be able to add the HASH code when embedding videos from vimeo._
h3. Why This Is Important

_This is impacting directly customers that have material on vimeo and need to embed them in confluence._
h3. Workaround

_No workaround available. This is a upload from VIMEO._
fields.summary: Object Connector macro needs to work with Vimeo hash

h3. Issue Summary

There's a documented API that delete trashed content from Space's trash:
[Delete content|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content/#api-wiki-rest-api-content-id-delete]
However, this API requires a contentid parameter and there's is no way available to get this ID from API or UI for the deleted content, even with admin user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Delete a page.
 # Use the below API to delete it:
{code}curl --request DELETE \
  --url 'https://your-domain.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/{id}?status=trashed' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access_token>'{code}

h3. Expected Results
If there is an API which needs contentid then there should be a way to get contentid without having to restore the deleted page.

h3. Actual Results
When the page is in trash, we are not able to see its contentid using any method (from end user end)

h3. Workaround

Delete the page/attachment in the trash using UI.
fields.summary: Admins cannot get contentid of the trashed content from UI or API

fields.description:
*Problem:*

The current situation is that it is not possible to set up filters in my emails client (Outlook) to sort Confluence notifications depending on which part of Confluence space the changes originated from.

The only filter I can create in Outlook is for sorting notifications originated from different Confluence spaces. This way, notifications about ALL changes made in the Confluence space will be sent to me. This does not help much.

What I would like to have is that I could set Outlook filters to sort separately notifications originated from different locations in my Confluence space(s).

 

For example:

I want to receive email notifications about changes made in the "Developer" branch, but not in the "SQA" branch:
 * Confluence Space Pages
 ** Wiki
 *** SQA
 *** *{color:#00875a}Developer <= only want to get notifications made in this subtree{color}*
 *** Infra
 *** General
 *** Process

*Proposed solution*

I found this TreeView plugin in Atlassian Marketplace: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213286/tree-view]. It enables filtering Confluence notifications based on a Confluence-user "page watch"-preferences. A user can subscribe for notifications about changes made in different sub-trees in the pages hierarchy.

It would be helpful to have similar functionality in Confluence out of the box.
fields.summary: As a user, I want better sorting of Confluence notification emails to be possible

Sticky header is aligned with table.
h3. Actual Results

h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to the Confluence site.
 # Click on the !image-2021-09-22-16-41-01-444.png|width=18,height=18!  icon on the top right cornor.
 # Navigate to Space Permission -> select the space under Individual Spaces
 # You can see the *Chat Notification* user is already there regardless of whether the slack integration app is enabled or not.

h3. Expected Results
 * If Individual Spaces is enabled, the *Chat Notification* user will be added automatically.
 * If Individual Spaces is disabled, the *Chat Notification* user will be removed automatically.

h3. Actual Results

The *Chat Notification* user is bundled with Confluence and is already there of whether the slack integration app is enabled or not.
h3. Workaround

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When [moving pages|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/] using the *Browse* option, if the target (or the same) space has 25 or more pages that are not child pages of the home/overview one, it will not be possible to see all pages from the tree, including the home page and its child ones.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to have a space with more than 25 pages (ideally, 25 pages and the home page with some child pages within it).
 # As an administrator of this space, go to *Space settings* > *Content Tools* > *Reorder pages*).
 # There, [hide the 25 pages|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/#Move-copy-andhidepages-Hidepages] by dragging and dropping them to be at the same level/above the home page.
 # Now, try to [move a different page|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/#Move-copy-andhidepages-Movepages] to this space by using the *Browse* option.

h3. Expected Results

All pages from the page tree (including the hidden ones or only the ones below the home page) should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

Only the first 25 pages are displayed, blocking pages like the Home one to be displayed, including its child. If the home page is the 25th page, it will be displayed in the dialog, allowing the child pages to be visible as well.
h3. Workaround
 * Use the *Search* option from the Move dialog.
 * Drag and drop the 25 hidden pages to be under a specific parent of the hidden list. This way, these pages will still be hidden, but at the same time, will allow the home page to be found while moving a page.
fields.summary: The move page dialog does not display all the page tree
Stop Watching Confluence Page but still receiving notifications
File previews within third-party macros do not render

Tooltip for macros on a page not getting translated as per the individual users language setting on account level.

1. Set your account to (for example) "Deutsch" in the language settings under account settings.
2. Open Confluence Cloud and edit a page.
3. Insert a macro, for example: table with two rows and a header.
4. Save page.
5. Hover mouse pointer over the sorting/header of the table -> tool tip is shown in english language.

h3. Expected Results

The language for the tool tip should also reflect as per the user's language settings.

h3. Actual Results

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
Sometimes teams have a space or page(s) which are view only to extended team members.

These teams sometimes need to assign tasks to these view only users, however they are unable to mark their task as complete.

It would be convenient to allow view only users to check off tasks which they are assigned.

Example of a real use case:

Every team/group has it's own space. Each space is open for edit for the team, and for view for all the employees.
Most of the meeting minutes are cross-team. So a team member that called the meeting is writing a meeting summary in his space, and assigns tasks to other people form other teams. Those people have only view permission of the space, but they were allocated a task. they cannot mark this task as complete.
fields.summary: Allow users with view only permissions to check off tasks that they are assigned
Add fully-qualified avatar URLs to Confluence Cloud User REST endpoints

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Confluence search is a feature that is always there for us - we are able to find our content easily most of the time with just a single word. 
This is something that makes the difference in the daily Confluence usability but sounds like Confluence only searches for pages, blogposts, attachments, and spaces by default. If we need to search for Questions, or Calendars, for example, we need to jump in the Advanced Search and define the content type we are looking for.

h3. Suggestion
* Whenever we search for something using either the quick search or the advanced one (with no filters), Confluence should return all the related content with the search string we are searching, so it would return pages, calendars, blogposts, questions, attachments, and whatever the content that matches the search.
If the users desire to search for a specific kind of content, then they could use the search filters.
fields.summary: Improve search results on Confluence

fields.description: Because many spaces may contain pages with the same name (e.g., "Meeting Notes"), when creating smart links to such pages (e.g., Jira issues, comments, etc.), it would be helpful to also include some additional identifier such as the Space Key (e.g., "Meeting Notes (SVC)") so that users can easily identify the associated space at a glance without inspecting the URL or following the link.
fields.summary: Include Space Key in Smart Links to Confluence Pages.

fields.description:
Summary: Add statement regarding Confluence Page title Case sensitivity in the public documentation.

In Confluence Cloud Pages can be created with the same name with different lower and upper cases like Test, tEst, TEST, etc.

Add the same in [Create, edit, and publish a page|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-edit-and-publish-a-page/].
fields.summary: Add statement regarding Confluence Page title Case sensitivity in the public documentation

fields.description:
*Problem:*

The current situation is that it is not possible to set up filters in my emails client (Outlook) to sort Confluence notifications depending on which part of Confluence space the changes originated from.

The only filter I can create in Outlook is for sorting notifications originated from different Confluence spaces. This way, notifications about ALL changes made in Confluence space will be sent to me. This does not help much.

What I would like to have is that I could set Outlook filters to sort separately notifications originated from different locations in my Confluence space(s).

 

For example:

I want to receive email notifications about changes made in the "Developer" branch, but not in the "SQA" branch. (see picture below)

!image-2021-09-20-14-53-12-939.png|width=184,height=382!

 

*Proposed solution*

I found this TreeView plugin in Atlassian Marketplace: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213286/tree-view. It enables filtering Confluence notifications based on a Confluence-user "page watch"-preferences. A user can subscribe for notifications about changes made in different sub-trees in the pages hierarchy.

It would be helpful to have similar functionality in Confluence out of the box.
fields.summary: As a user, I want better sorting of Confluence notification emails to be possible

fields.description:
The Confluence page currently displays the information of the developer who recently made edits and of the creator of the confluence page. 

This feature when added will display a list of developers who have contributed to the page throughout history.

Advancement in the feature could enclose that when the mouse is hovered over the contributor, it should display more information about the contributor. Once clicked on the contributor's pic/name/icon, their contribution should be displayed.
fields.summary: Feature Suggestion: Display Contributors on the Confluence Page

fields.description:
Currently, the timeout we have at the breaker is the same as the Timeout in Druid. Both are set to 20 seconds.

We would like to understand if it will help us to have the breaker timeout slightly more than the Druid timeout. 

Will it help us in any way to cleanly shut down the open connections with Druid or it doesn't matter?

The goal of this ticket is to understand these questions

[https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CAI/pages/1334323861/Druid+circuit+breaker+timeout+test]

The steps mentioned on the page might help to simulate network latency locally.

 

*Acceptance Criteria*

 1. Recommendation is made whether to increase the breaker timeout or not

2. The PR is created based on the recommendation
fields.summary: Understand if increasing the breaker timeout more than the Druid timeout will help here

fields.description:
Sometimes a space import fails or times out making it impossible to delete it from the UI. When this happens, the space information becomes corrupt in the database. These partially imported spaces remain in the DB without any way to remove them via the UI, making a re-import attempt impossible (due to a duplicate Space Key or other constraint violation). 
 Confluence does not automatically recognize partially/faulty Space imports and delete related data from the backend, hence it would be good to have an option in the UI to undo/revert the import.
fields.summary: Option to undo/revert a space import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* When a Page Properties is set to "Hidden", any word on the page that matches any partial text inside the Page Properties macro, cannot have an inline comment added to it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page, and add a "Page Properties" macro, and tick the "Hidden" option.
# Add some text inside of the "Page Properties" macro.
** {code:java}
Apples
Caterpillar{code}
# Now add the following text on the page itself, outside of the "Page Properties" macro.
** {code:java}
Apples
Application
Caterpillar
Cat
Cats
{code}
# Publish the page, and try to add some inline comments.
# Any word that matches the full, or partial text inside of the "Page Properties" macro will fail.
** Apples (x)
** Application (/)
** App (from Application) (x)
*** Fails as it matches "App" from "Apple" inside of the "Page Properties" macro.
** Caterpillar (x)
** Cat (x)
*** Fails as it matches "Cat" from "Caterpillar" inside of the "Page Properties" macro.
** Cats (/)
** Cat (from Cats) (x)
*** Fails as it matches "Cat" from "Caterpillar" inside of the "Page Properties" macro.

h3. Expected Results
* We're able to add inline comments for any words in the Page Properties macro.

h3. Actual Results
*  Any word that matches the words in the Page Properties macro cannot have inline comments added to them.
* The error below is thrown by the Inline comment editor.
** {code}We’re having trouble adding your comment. Try highlighting more or less text.{code}
* The error below is seen in the network tab.
** {code}
[{errors: [{,…}], data: null}]
0: {errors: [{,…}], data: null}
data: null
errors: [{,…}]
0: {,…}
extensions: {microsID: "...............",…}
message: "..............: com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.BadRequestException: Failed to insert highlight, invalid originalSelection, numMatches, or matchIndex"
path: ["createInlineComment"]
0: "createInlineComment"
{code}

h3. Workaround
* Make the Page Properties macro visible by unchecking the "Hidden" checkbox.
* Highlight more text so that it unmatches any string than the words inside the Page Properties macro.
** Example: From above, we cannot highlight "Cat", but "Cats" is fine.
fields.summary: Hidden Page Properties makes words unusable for inline comments on page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Confluence, when a space has a home page that does not have any child pages, no pages will be displayed in the sidebar as the root of the sidebar is the home one.

However, if the space has no home page configured, the pages will be displayed in the sidebar.

h3.Suggestion

As it can cause confusion to understand why a space with a home page (without child pages) does not display pages in the sidebar and a space without a home page at all display pages, this is a suggestion to either:

* Display the pages in the sidebar even if the home page does not have child pages. This would be a similar approach to spaces that do not have a home page.
* Clarify that it is necessary to move the pages to be under the home page in order to display them in the sidebar.
fields.summary: Sidebar should display content regardless of the parent home page

fields.description:
Hello,

We configured confluence on single server to support one of our application in AWS. In order support our site to provide high availability, scalable capacity, and performance at scale we are planning to cluster our environment by having multiple nodes. So, can you please support us by providing the support and what are all the steps required to follow to migrate to cluster environment. I did follow the below documentation for the setup and I have multiple questions regarding the  Step 6. Configure your cluster.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/set-up-a-confluence-data-center-cluster-982322030.html]

Question 1) Which is the best process to follow to provide the IP's or AWS - enter your IAM Role or secret key, and region?

Question 2) if we provide the IP's and if suppose we lost one node and wanted to configure another node and replace the IP. Is there any process or steps we need to follow?

Question 3) can you explain more on the The network interface Confluence will use to communicate between nodes. We know about Elastic Network Interface but not sure what exactly needs to provide here?

 

We currently want to implement this in our Stage Environment and move to prod later after successful migration.

 

Thanks,

Ramesh
fields.summary: Need to Cluster our Confluence Setup which is serving on Single Server
